content:
Which of the two APIs: docs#FormalMultilinearSeries vs. docs#PowerSeries / docs#MvPowerSeries, is more proper to use when talking about generating functions of sequences (for example, generating functions in combinatorics)?

If the latter API (docs#PowerSeries) is better for combinatorics, would it be a good addition for Mathlib introducing the composition of formal power series? I see the addition and (Cauchy) product already defined, I might be missing others if they are in other files.

I have been thinking about trying to formalise some generating functions for combinatorics, and looking into the API for power series. With the recent addition of some topology, what you are describing should not be too difficult (except, at my own level, everything is difficult).

At least in the case of single variable power series, I'd think one would start by proving that the familiy of powers of a power series with null (or just nilpotent?) constant coefficient is summable (for the product of discrete topologies: we are talking about formal power series, right?).
Surely power series are the things to use for generating functions.
